snippet: Officer Brad Miller violated several principles of modern-day policing before he fatally shot an unarmed black college student, according to law enforcement veterans.
abstract: Law enforcement experts say Arlington, Tex, Officer Brad Miller violated basic procedure when he pursued Christian Taylor, resulting in Taylor's death; swift firing and public accounting of incident appears to be new standard response among police chiefs in wake of multiple shooting deaths involving police and unarmed African-Americans.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Arlington, and Timothy Williams from New York. Patrick McGee contributed reporting from Arlington. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Officer Brad Miller violated several principles of modern-day policing before he fatally shot an unarmed black college student, according to law enforcement veterans.

headline.main: Texas Officer Who Killed Unarmed Man Made Mistakes, Police Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Officer Who Killed Unarmed Man Made Mistakes, Police Experts Say
